required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Corneal Wounds Repair Emergencies During COVID-19 : 10/0 Absorbable Polyglactin Sutures as a Valuable Strategy
clinical_study.official_title: Corneal Wounds Repair Emergencies During COVID-19 : 10/0 Absorbable Polyglactin Sutures as a Valuable Strategy

lead_sponsor.agency: Centre Hospitalier Universitaire de Saint Etienne

clinical_study.source: Centre Hospitalier Universitaire de Saint Etienne

brief_summary.textblock:
Vicryl (polyglactin) 10-0 resorbable suture is rarely used, little known to ophthalmologists but may offer therapeutic and practical advantages in eligible cases of corneal trauma, particularly during a COVID-19 pandemic.
This has imposed new sanitary restrictions : limited access to the operating room in ophthalmology only for functional emergencies and a drastically reduced capacity for external consultations in favor of teleconsultation. The aim of this study is to evaluate the Vicryl 10-0 (polyglactin 910) resorbable monofilament suture in corneal trauma, rather than classic Nylon 10-0: structural and functional results, and adaptation of postoperative follow-up during a sanitary crisis period.

primary_outcome.description: Collected in the medical record pre and post operating.
Collected in the medical record pre and post operating.

secondary_outcome.description: Collected in the medical record at post operating. Measured by OCT-TOMEY-CASIA).
Collected in the medical record. All adverse events connecting to the eye surgery.

arm_group.arm_group_label: corneal trauma sutured with Vicryl 10-0 monofilament
arm_group.description: corneal trauma sutured with Vicryl 10-0 monofilament will be included. They will have data collection of medical records.

intervention.description: Collection of clinical and paraclinical data during preoperative consultation Collection of clinical and paraclinical data during post-operative consultations Tele-consultation to determine if criteria for good healing / adherence, treatment tolerance / response to questions Remote follow-up 6 and 12 months after the trauma
intervention.arm_group_label: corneal trauma sutured with Vicryl 10-0 monofilament

study_pop.textblock: Patients who had an emergency eye surgery in the Saint-Etienne University Hospital from 18/03/2020 to 05/12/20

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Corneal penetrating injury and/or lamellar laceration, or corneal melting in inflammatory diseases
Exclusion Criteria:
- Corneal Penetrating injury trauma requiring necessarily Nylon 10-0
- Traumatism requiring a cryopreserved human amniotic membrane
- Traumatism eligible for biological glue (wound < 2 mm)
